info.description: Build applications using the world's most powerful imagery
info.title: Getty Images

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Specifies the id of the channel for the asset data. Valid channel ids can be found in the results of the Get Partner Channel query.
parameters.name: channel_id

parameters.description: Specifies the number of assets to return. The default is 10; maximum is 500.
parameters.name: batch_size

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

403.description: Your access token does not authorize access to this resource

404.description: The channel you specified does not exist

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Specify the change-set-id associated with a transaction resource whose receipt you want to confirm.
parameters.name: change-set-id

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

403.description: Your access token does not authorize access to this resource

delete.summary: Confirm asset changes acknowledges receipt of asset changes.

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.

get.summary: Retrieves the channel data for the partner. This data can be used to populate the channel_id parameter in the Put Asset Changes query.

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Specify JSON containing an array of asset ids to register.    Limited to 500 asset ids per call.
parameters.name: request

200.description: Success - The assets were successfully registered.

401.description: AuthorizationTokenRequired - Authorization token was missing or not valid.

500.description: AssetRegistrationFailed - There was a failure when registering assets.

post.summary: Register a list of customer assets.

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

get.summary: ***BETA*** Returns a list of boards for the authenticated user.

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Id of board to get details and assets for.
parameters.name: board_id

get.summary: ***BETA*** Returns metadata for a specific board given its id.

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Id of the asset to add. If it is already in the board's asset collection, no action taken.
parameters.name: asset_id

parameters.description: Id of board to add asset to.
parameters.name: board_id

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Specifies the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

get.summary: Gets collections applicable for the customer.

parameters.description: Specifies the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

get.summary: Gets countries codes and names.

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or after this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss). If time is omitted, midnight is assumed. Date/times are UTC.
parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or before this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss). If time is omitted, midnight is assumed. Date/times are UTC.
parameters.name: date_to

parameters.description: Identifies page to return. Default is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specifies page size. Default is 30, maximum page_size is 100.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results.
parameters.name: product_type

get.summary: Returns information about a customer's downloaded assets.

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                                image available.
                                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.description:
Additional information required from specific customers when downloading. 
                                        Only users who have been set up with a project code by Getty Images Sales need to use this field.
parameters.name: download_details

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Id of image to download.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Specifies whether to auto-download the image. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                                        Location header set to the location of the image.
                                        If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.
parameters.name: auto_download

parameters.description: File Type expressed with three character file extension.
parameters.name: file_type

parameters.description:
Specifies the pixel height of the particular image to download.
                                        Available heights can be found in the images/{ids} response for the specific image.
                                        If left blank, it will return the largest available size.
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.
parameters.name: product_id

parameters.description: Product type.
parameters.name: product_type

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                                video available.
                                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Id of video to download.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Specifies whether to auto-download the video. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                                        Location header set to the location of the video.
                                        If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.
parameters.name: auto_download

parameters.description: Specifies the size to be downloaded.
parameters.name: size

parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Filter based on the age of individuals in an image.

parameters.description: Specifies the image licensing model(s).
parameters.name: license_models

parameters.description: Filter based on the number of people in the image.

parameters.description: Return only images with selected aspect ratios.
parameters.name: orientations

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Request number of images to return in each page.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Search images using a search phrase.
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: Restrict search results to prestige images. The default is false.
parameters.name: prestige_content_only

parameters.description: Filter images to those having product types from the selected list.
parameters.name: product_types

parameters.description: Select sort order of results.

parameters.description: Return only images associated with specific people (using a comma-delimited list).
parameters.name: specific_people

get.summary: Search for editorial videos

parameters.description: Accept-Language parameter optional. Used to restrict the set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description:
Specifies up to 1000 sets of asset Id, usage count, and date of use to submit usages for. 
                        Note that all asset Ids specified must be valid or the operation will fail causing no usages to be recorded. 
                        The date format should be ISO 8601 (ex: YYYY-MM-DD), time is not needed.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: Specifies a unique batch transaction id to identify the report.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Authorization token required. Used for applying content access restrictions. Use one of the OAuth2 grants to auto-populate this value.
parameters.name: Authorization

200.description: Success - All usages reported were successfully recorded.

400.description: InvalidAssets - Invalid assets found in the request.

401.description: UnauthorizedToReportUsage - User was not authorized to report usages. Contact your Getty Images Account Manager to discuss options for submitting your usage data.

409.description: TransactionIdDuplicated - The id parameter supplied was already used in a previous usage report.

put.summary: Report usage of assets via a batch format.

parameters.description: Specifies the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Specifies one or more video ids to return. Use comma delimiter when requesting multiple ids.
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Get metadata for multiple videos by supplying multiple video ids

parameters.description: Specifies the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: A video id. For more than one video please use the /v3/video endpoint.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: comma delimited list of fields to retrive for the video
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Get metadata for a single video by supplying one video id

download_notes.description: Associate a note with the download of an image.

project_code.description: Specifies the associated project code saved with the downloaded of an image.

id.description: Specifies the editorial source id of the image

name.description: Specifies the editorial source name of the image

ChannelId.description: The id to the channel of content

download_notes.description: Associate a note with the download of an image.

project_code.description: Specifies the associated project code saved with the downloaded of an image.

asset_id.description: Specifies the unique identifier for the asset.

asset_type.description: Indicates the asset type classification. Possible values are: image, video.

date_purchased.description: Specifies the date the asset was downloaded, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

license_model.description: Specifies the licensing model for the asset. Possible values are: royaltyfree, rightsmanaged, rightsready.

thumb_uri.description: GET this URI to download the thumbnail.

result_count.description: Count of previously purchased assets returned.

date_purchased.description: Specifies the date the image was downloaded, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

image_id.description: Specifies the unique identifier for the image.

license_model.description: Specifies the licensing model for the image. Possible values are: royaltyfree, rightsmanaged.

thumb_uri.description: GET this URI to download the thumbnail.

result_count.description: Count of previously purchased images returned.

products.description: List of available Getty Images products.

RegisterAssetsRequest.description: Specify request containing the list of asset ids you want to register.

asset_ids.description: Specifies the list of asset ids you want to register.

how_can_i_use_it.description: Specifies how the asset can be used.

asset_usage.description: Specifies the id, usage quantity, and date of when an asset was used.

asset_id.description: Specifies the Id of the asset that was used.

quantity.description: Specifies the number of times the asset was used.

usage_date.description: Identifies the date the asset was used, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD), time is not needed.

asset_family.description: Indicates the asset family classification. Possible values are: creative, editorial.

code.description: Specifies the code of the collection.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier for the collection.

license_model.description: Specifies the licensing model for the asset. Possible values are: royaltyfree, rightsmanaged, rightsready.

name.description: Specifies the name of the collection.

product_types.description: Specifies the license agreements applied to this collection. Possible values are: premiumaccess, easyaccess, editorialsubscription, imagepack, royaltyfreesubscription.

collections.description: List of collections that belongs to the client.

iso_alpha_2.description: The 2 Character ISO 3166-1 code for the country aka US, GB, CA, MX.

iso_alpha_3.description: The 3 character ISO 3166-1 code for the country aka USA, CAN, GBR, MEX.

name.description: Specifies the name of the country.

allowed_use.description: Specifies how customers are allowed to use the image.

alternative_ids.description: Lists all of the alternative ids for the asset.

asset_family.description: Indicates the asset family classification. Possible values are: creative, editorial.

call_for_image.description: Indicates whether a customer needs to call Getty Images in order to license this image.

caption.description: Gives a brief description of the image.

collection_code.description: Specifies the code of the collection to which the image belongs.

collection_id.description: Specifies the id of the collection to which the image belongs.

collection_name.description: Specifies the name of the collection to which the image belongs.

color_type.description: Specifies whether the image or video is color or black and white. Possible values are color, black_and_white, and null.

copyright.description: Specifies the copyright of the image.

date_camera_shot.description: Specifies the date the image was shot, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

date_created.description: Specifies the date the image was created, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

display_sizes.description: Lists the display sizes available for this image.

graphical_style.description: Specifies the graphical style for the image. Possible values are Photography, Fine Art, and Illustration.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier for the image.

keywords.description: Lists the keywords that are associated with this image.

largest_downloads.description: Lists the available largest download sizes.

license_model.description: Specifies the licensing model for the image. Possible values are: royaltyfree, rightsmanaged.

max_dimensions.description: Specifies the maximum height and width of any size for this image.

orientation.description: Specifies the orientation of the image. Possible values are: Horizontal, PanoramicHorizontal, PanoramicVertical, Square, Vertical, and null.

prestige.description: Specifies the image is in the curated Prestige collection.

product_types.description: Lists the product types for the image. Possible values are: premiumaccess, easyaccess, editorialsubscription, imagepack, royaltyfreesubscription.

quality_rank.description: Assigned to editorial images to rank their relevance to the event they belong to. This number has no relevance for creative images even though it does appear in the metadata. Possible values are: 1 - most relevant, 2 - tells story from a wider perspective, 3 - stock/repeats/less important.

referral_destinations.description: Lists the referral destinations for Getty Images assets.

uri_oembed.description: GET this URI to retrieve the display image, if embeddable.

result_count.description: Specifies the count of matching images returned.
Specifies the count of matching assets returned.

date_downloaded.description: Specifies the date the asset was downloaded, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

download_details.description: Customer stored details associated with this download.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier of the asset.

product_type.description: Specifies the license agreement applied to this download. Possible values are: premiumaccess, easyaccess, editorialsubscription, imagepack, royaltyfreesubscription, sandbox.

thumb_uri.description: GET this URI to download the thumbnail.

is_note_required.description: Indicates if users must enter a note on download.

is_project_code_required.description: Indicates if users must enter a product code on download.

project_codes.description: Only users who have been set up with a project code by Getty Sales need to use this field.

bit_depth.description: Specifies the bit depth of the video.

broadcast_video_standard.description: Indicates broadcast video standard of the video (e.g., NTSC, PAL).

content_type.description: Specifies the content type of the video (e.g., "video/mp4").

format.description: Specifies the video format (e.g., SD, HD, 4K, Multimedia, or Web).

interlaced.description: Specifies whether the video is interlaced.

name.description: Specifies the name of the video size.

downloads.description: Provides a list of download items.

relevance.description: Specifies the relevancy of the keyword to the asset. 0-5 or null, 5 being most relevant.

text.description: Provides localized text of the keyword.

rel.description: Specifies the link's relationship to the asset.

uri.description: GET this URI to retrieve image details regarding the related resource.

country.description: Specifies the country where the event took place.

state_province.description: Specifies the state or province where the event took place.

venue.description: Specifies the venue where the event took place.

download_limit.description: Specifies the download limit for product or package.

download_limit_duration.description: Specifies the end date of current download limit.

download_limit_reset_utc_date.description: Specifies the date when download limit will reset, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

download_requirements.description: Specifies the download requirements a company can apply on its users.

expiration_utc_date.description: Specifies the expiration date, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31T00:00:00-00:00).

name.description: Specifies the name of Getty Images product.

status.description: Specifies if product status is active or inactive.

uri.description: GET this URI to retrieve appropriate referral destination data.

asset_usages.description: Identifies the list of asset id, usage count and date of usage combinations to record.

report_usage_batch_response.description: Specifies the response from the Batch Usages endpoint.

invalid_assets.description: Identifies a list of asset ids submitted that did not match known Getty asset ids.

total_asset_usages_processed.description: Specifies the number of asset usage records that were successfully recorded.
